title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
author: Khaled Hosseini
review: Reviewed this one at 3 am upon promptly finishing in a single setting. Yes, I was a wreck.

title: Beartown
author: Fredrik Backman
review: Nostalgia has led me places I wouldn't even go with a gun.

title: Bluestar's Prophecy
author: Erin Hunter
review: The title-holder for favorite book of all time since the age of 8.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
review: I liked this book so much I went and bought it. So, yeah.

title: I Who Have Never Known Men
author: Jacqueline Harpman

title: Lapvona
author: Ottessa Moshfegh
review: A most macabre borderline-Shakespearean affair. Moshfegh unleashes a fiefdom of bleak fury that settles into the pit of your stomach.

title: Pachinko
author: Min Jin Lee
review: Beautiful prose, a story that transports across generations and lifetimes.

title: Sunrise on the Reaping
author: Suzanne Collins
review: Ms. Suzanne Collins did not come to play with her dystopian (historical) fiction x Edgar Allen Poe crossover.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: ⭐️⭐️⭐️ bc does nobody actually get over anything?

title: The Just City
author: Jo Walton
review: A Socratic approach to ethics in the era just preceeding AI cats.
